title: Relative motion - driving east and north

content.question: Car <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math> is traveling east with a speed of <math alttext="30 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mtext> m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>. Car <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> is traveling north with speed of <math alttext="40 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>40</mn><mtext> m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>. What is the direction of the velocity of Car <math alttext="B" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>B</mtext></math> relative to Car <math alttext="A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>A</mtext></math>?

choices.label: <math alttext="53 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mn>53</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup></math> north of west
<math alttext="53 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mn>53</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup></math> north of east
<math alttext="53 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mn>53</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup></math> south of east

content.answer: <math alttext="53 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mn>53</mn><mo>∘</mo></msup></math> north of west

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
